meanings.sent1: The old teddy bear looked raggy with its torn arm.
meanings.sent2: The raggy curtains fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The raggy scarecrow in the field made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt raggy after the breakup, torn and worn.

meanings.definition: Covered in rags or scraps of cloth.
meanings.sent1: The stray dog had a raggy coat that kept him warm.
meanings.sent2: She wore a raggy scarf knitted by her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The raggy blanket on the couch was cozy despite its appearance.
meanings.sent4: The raggy patches on his jeans told stories of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The raggy quilt was a patchwork of memories and love.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a rag.
meanings.sent1: The old book had raggy pages that crumbled at the touch.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was raggy and unkempt after a windy walk.
meanings.sent3: The raggy clouds in the sky looked like torn cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded raggy, like an old record playing.
meanings.sent5: The raggy doll had been loved so much, its seams were frayed.
